Having another kid... (begins to snowball) ... Thanksgiving, Christmas, spring break, football games, all of a sudden they're out of school, getting jobs, getting married, And then, you know... I'm a grandparent. I'm retired. Before you know it - I'm dead... and I just kept thinking... "What's the point?" Ryan gulps. Fuck.
(now asking Ryan directly) I mean what is the point?
The point?
Yeah, I mean, what am I starting here?
It's marriage... it's the most beautiful thing on Earth... you know, what everyone aspires to... 96.
You never got married.
That's true...
You never even tried.
Well, it's hard to define "try".
You seem happier than most of my married friends. Ryan takes a beat.
Jim, I'm not going to lie. Marriage can be a pain in the ass. And you're kind of right - All of this is just stuff on the way to your eventual demise.

head_text.subj: KARA EAVESDROPPING AT THE DOOR WITH A LOOK OF COLD FEAR

text: We are all on running clocks that cannot be slowed down or paused and they all lead to the same place. Some guys leave marks that last beyond their own mortality. Not guys like you and me... But some. But even those footprints disappear.
There isn't a "point". Jim sinks a little.
I'm not the guy you'd normally want to talk to about all this stuff... But think about it - your favorite memories. The greatest moments of your life? Were you alone? 97.
(thinks about it) No... I guess not.
I don't want to sound like a Hallmark card, but... Life? It's better with company. Jim nods.
Come to think of it... Last night, the night before your wedding, when all this shit was circling through your head... Weren't you two sleeping in separate rooms?
Yeah, Julie went back to the apartment and I was all alone in that big honeymoon suite... Jim chuckles to himself.
Kind of lonely?
Yeah.
Hey. Everybody needs a copilot. This resonates with Jim and he can't help but smile.
That's a nice touch.
Thanks.
What's the mood like out there?
It's not good... Emotional.
What should I do?
(twinkle in his eye) Go get her. 98.
Jim walks over to the huddle of bride's maids. They part let him in. He kneels at Julie's feet...

I'm sorry I'm such a fuck up... Will you be my co-pilot? Julie gives him a perplexed look before smiling and falli into his arms. Tears and smiles spread amongst the girls. Kara walks over to Ryan and pats him on the shoulder.
Welcome home.

head_text.subj: BEGINS AS A SERIES OF IMAGES

text: - Ryan and Alex getting dressed in a little kitchen in th church. They're in a hurry and a little sloppy, but there crooked joy in their faces. - Jim standing at the alter with the priest getting a pat the back from his best man. - Julie getting walked to the alter by Jim's uncle. They Ryan, who looks on proudly. - The priest gives his blessings. - Jim raises Julie's veil. They kiss. - Wedding attendees file into the Chalet Suites Banquet H - Ryan and Alex mingle with their table.
Hi, I'm Ryan.
I'm your cousin... Harold.

Oh, hey! - Ryan and Alex dance like teenagers. - The band does a cheesy choreographed dance step. - Jim makes a speech. He is not good at public speaking, the guests are generous with laughter. - Tammy has her tongue down a groomsmen's throat. 99. - Ryan pulls Kara onto the dance floor. She rests her hea his shoulder and they slow dance. - Jim and Julie make their farewell and run off. - Ryan and Alex help pick the center pieces off the table - Ryan and Alex get into the elevator together. She's wea his jacket. We're about to see them kiss, when the elevat door closes.
Ryan and Alex stand between their gates. One sign reads OMAHA. The other sign reads CHICAGO.
When am I going to see you?
You're just going to have to come and visit.
So settled down. You're not going to change on me...
Same guy. Just one address. We hear a boarding announcement for Chicago. Alex begins step away to her gate.
Call me if you get lonely. A beat. And then...
... I'm lonely. Alex turns for her gate and joins the crowd. Ryan goes to something. He has an impulse... but he finally ignores it gets in line under the sign that reads "OMAHA".

The door opens and Ryan wheels in his Roll-Away. He walks to the window, parts the blinds and checks out his awful 100. We see Ryan opening some mail. We see Ryan laying in bed. It's quiet. It's alone.
Natalie is giving Ryan a tour of the new ONLINE FIRING AR A series of cubicles with YOUNG GUYS ON HEADSETS. She is her element and very proud of her work.
... Some guy sits down in a conference room somewhere and a server routes their session to one of our termination engineers.
You don't actually call them that.
I prefer "terminators", but it bumped with legal.
Really? I can't imagine why.
They follow a workflow that can take them through anything from a standard dismissal to a violent aggressor.
Are they actually on line, right now?

No, they're beta-testing. Role-playing. We go live at the end of the month. (catches one of the guys making a mistake) Kyle, you're running through the events too quickly. You have to give them time to acknowledge each statement. Okay? It's a legal thing. Ryan can only watch.
Ryan is sitting at his desk. He puts on a HEADSET.
This is ridiculous. 101.
Craig is leading a meeting. Ryan seems focused on somethi on his laptop. We see his screen: An itinerary for GoalQu
One of the GIANT DIGITAL MARQUEES reads: "GOALQUEST XX"
Ryan sits on a sofa, holding his BACKPACK. A slick GOALQU HOST enters the room.
You ready to rock? Ryan nods and gets up.

Ryan stands in the wings. He takes a breath, then steps o in front of a sea of people. The GOALQUEST XX stage is like nothing we've seen yet. La and professional. Blue Banners hang from the ceiling. Dig projectors show Ryan's Headshot - What's In Your Backpack Ryan sets the BACK PACK on a table and quickly unzips it. A breath.
Last year, I flew three hundred fifty thousand miles. The moon is only two fifty. A long beat. Uncomfortable. Ryan looks at the back pack.

Imagine for a second that you're carrying a backpack... I want you to feel the straps on your shoulders... You feel them? Ryan isn't feeling them. He is not inspired. He isn't believable. He's barely even there. 102.
Now, I want you to pack it with all the stuff you have in your life. Start with the little things. Ryan is trying, but he can't find the will to do this.
The... um... The stuff in drawers and on shelves. Ryan takes a beat. He just stares at the backpack and thi about all the things he has removed from it... And then..
Excuse me. And with that, Ryan leaves the stage. Handlers try to fig out what Ryan is doing. The Host runs for the mic.
What the fuck are you doing?
Okay, everyone just relax. We'll have your next guest out in a sec.
Ryan hustles past SLOT MACHINES until he is actually jogg
Ryan runs up to a gate. He's the last one to board.
Over Ryan's shoulder, through the window, we see Chicago below as the flight begins its descent.

location: CORRIDOR OF LIGHT, CHICAGO O'HARE AIRPORT

text: Ryan on the PEOPLE MOVER under the ceiling of NEON LIGHTS Peaceful music emits from hidden speakers. Ryan walks bri past idle riders. 103.
Ryan hurriedly signs a hand-held device, hops into a SEDA and speeds off. The RENTAL CAR ASSISTANT suddenly realize
Hey, you forgot to give me your Devotion Club card!

Ryan steps out of his rental car and approaches the door the townhouse - checking the address against a piece of HILTON STATIONARY. Ryan stops, knocks, and puts on a smile. We hear Footsteps. The door unlocks and opens revealing A She's wearing sweatpants and glasses. She's at home. She looks different.
Surprise. But there's something else. Alex is in shock... She's fro Something's wrong. Ryan's smile begins to melt. A man's voice calls from inside.

Honey, who's at the door? A couple kids run by through the background, giggling. A chases after them. Alex is still speechless. Her eyes are angry and apologiz all at the same time. Ryan just stands there. Emotionally bleeding to death.
What are you doing here? Ryan begins to step away. He turns and heads for his car, dropping the flowers. Alex's husband becomes visible just as she's shutting the
Who was that? 104.
... just some guy who was lost. Ryan gets in his rental car and drives off.
We're watching Ryan through his window from far away... a as if looking through binoculars. He sits on his bed, tie undone, holding a glass with an inch of scotch on his kne
We see quick glimpses of Ryan getting ready. Crappy littl COFFEE MAKER crappily brewing. Crappy hotel BAR OF SOAP crappily lathering. Crappy HAIR DRYER crappily blowing.
Ryan is on the phone with Alex.
How could you lie to me?
Alex sits in the car with the engine running.
What were you thinking - Just showing up at my door like that?
What do you mean? I wanted to see you. I didn't know you had a family - Why didn't you tell me that?
Come on, I thought we signed up for the same thing.
Try to help me understand. What is it you signed up for?
I thought our relationship was perfectly clear. You're...
(a long beat) ... an escape.
I'm an escape?
You know, a break from our normal lives... A parenthesis.
I'm a parenthesis?
Seriously, Ryan? I can't believe we're having this conversation. I mean what do you want? Ryan stumbles on this. What does he want?
You don't even know what you want. I'm sorry that I ruined your night... But you could have seriously screwed things up for me. That was my family. That's my real life.
I thought I was a part of your real life.

Look, Ryan. I'm a grown up. I don't hold a grudge. When you're ready to be an adult and see me again, just give me a call. Ryan can't quite believe what he's hearing. There's only thing he can do. He hangs up.
